discourse_list.title: TECHNICAL GRANT APPLICATION - WEB3 Game rocket Rocket

content.content: TECHNICAL GRANT APPLICATION - WEB3 Game  Rocket - TIER 1 APPLICATION INTRODUCTION We found https://philand.xyz/ startup and they had raised capital few days ago. The world of games is back again. Our goal is to create a simple game for all users, marketplace of items and earnings system. We already have a community in eastern Europe and Southeast Asia The basic idea is that we sell rockets at the launch of the game, and you move around the planets. Every time you can buy fuel tanks, the flight range depends on it. Also, at each stop - in our case, this is a planet, buy your own gas station, and receive income from it. Users can sell and buy fuel, rockets, tanks  rocket11440×1024 3.17 KB  Initially, the application will be released in web format, that is, the game in the browser, but we want to release a version on ElectronJS. We also want to draw tokens to attract new users and attention to the ecosystem TEAM Yakushev Hermann - CEO, I live in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, was born in Europe. NextJS, HTML, CSS, Solidity, NodeJS, Vue, React. instagram.com/yakushevhk Venedeev Vladimir - Design, live in Bangkok, Thailand. Figma, AdobeXD, Protopie, Illustrator TOTAL BUDGET AND FUNDING TIER We need 4-5k USD or more, and 3 weeks to release first version of the game. CURRENT FUNCTIONALITY Only prototype and design system, next stage - smartcontracts and frontend and backend TECHNICAL PROPOSAL New community to Conflux, nice Web3 Game and promotion for the network SYSTEM MODEL The working product will be released in March 2023 if we will start development now. And play the game in your browser DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP 2023 Q1-Q2 Release first Version 2023 Q1-Q2 Promotion 2023 Q3 List Tokens on DEX How many users does your project have currently? 300 in telegram MAINTENANCE CONSIDERATIONS Different modules will be added one by one, main functions will be not affected. Other projects from Optimism ecosystem are welcome and will be supported accordingly Send us an email to h@y7.hk or contact directly in Discord yakushev#3724 I confirm that I have read the landing pages for the Builders  and Growth Experiments  Sub-Committees and that I have determined my proposal is best suited to be reviewed by the Growth Experiments Sub-Committee: YES I understand that Growth Experiments grants are subject to a “no sale rule,” as explained in this post , and I have read the terms of the rule: YES I understand that I will be required to provide additional KYC information to the Optimism Foundation to receive this grant: YES I understand that I will be expected to following the public grant reporting requirements outlined here: YES ADDRESS 0xBEfe4C9961CF95771f64D5976D8673bC89b204d2
content.GPT-summary: The post is a technical grant application for a web3 game called Rocket. The author explains the game's concept, development roadmap, and budget. The post also invites feedback and collaboration from the readers. A 3rd party can give constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal. The author is also advertising the proposal to attract funding and support.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: I’m sorry but this proposal is missing a lot of key information from the proposal guidelines format. There is no information regarding distribution schedule related to each milestone.     Grants Proposal Template - Cycle 11 Grants       Based on the Cycle 10 experience, the Grants Council has determined that the Grant Proposal Template and submissions process can be improved to facilitate a more seamless experience for proposers and reviewers.  For Cycle 11, each Sub-Committee has created its own Grant Proposal Template, designed to guide proposers to provide information most relevant to the Sub-Committee’s evaluation criteria.  Proposers should copy the proposal template for the relevant Sub-Committee and start a new post to t…
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Here is the milestone assessment for you to review.    Milestone Assessment Grants       The Council has added guidance on what it is looking for in articulating milestones for assessing the success of a project. The guidance can be used by Cycle 11 applicants to provide more specificity on benchmarks and critical milestones. The guidance will also be provided to Cycle 10 final review proposers in order to develop a suitable set of milestones for the Council and community to monitor for grant awards. The Milestone Assessment guidance is available on the Council’s landing page, here,…
